created.title: Date Created
created.description: The date at which this Configuration was created.

type.title: Type
type.description: A type ID for this connector.

pipeline.title: Pipeline ID
pipeline.description: Name of the IndexPipeline used for processing output.

diagnosticLogging.title: Diagnostic Logging
diagnosticLogging.description: Enable diagnostic logging; disabled by default

parserId.title: Parser ID
parserId.description: The Parser to use in the associated IndexPipeline.

fetchSettings.title: Fetch Settings
fetchSettings.description: System level settings for controlling fetch behavior and performance.

numFetchThreads.title: Fetch Threads
numFetchThreads.description: Maximum number of fetch threads; defaults to 1. Slack REST API calls are throttled, and going above this number may harm performance more than it helps.

fetchResponseCompletedTimeout.title: Fetch response completion timeout(ms)
fetchResponseCompletedTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time for a response to be completed. If exceeded, the task will be retried if the job is still running

indexingInactivityTimeout.title: Indexing inactivity timeout(seconds)
indexingInactivityTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for indexing results (in seconds). If exceeded, the job will fail with an indexing inactivity timeout.

pluginInactivityTimeout.title: Plugin inactivity timeout(seconds)
pluginInactivityTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for plugin activity (in seconds). If exceeded, the job will fail with a plugin inactivity timeout.

indexMetadata.title: Index metadata
indexMetadata.description: When enabled the metadata of skipped items will be indexed to the content collection.

indexContentFields.title: Index content fields
indexContentFields.description: When enabled, content fields will be indexed to the crawl-db collection.

asyncParsing.title: Async Parsing
asyncParsing.description: When enabled, content will be indexed asynchronously.

indexingThreads.title: Index Subscription Threads
indexingThreads.description: Maximum number of indexing threads; defaults to 4.This setting controls the number of threads in the indexing service used for processing content documents emitted by this datasource.Higher values can sometimes help with overall fetch performance.

pluginInstances.title: Number of plugin instances for distributed fetching
pluginInstances.description: Maximum number of plugin instances for distributed fetching. Only specified number of plugin instanceswill do fetching. This is useful for distributing load between different instances.

fetchItemQueueSize.title: Fetch Item Queue Size
fetchItemQueueSize.description: Size of the fetch item queue.Larger values result in increased memory usage, but potentially higher performance.Default is 10k.

fetchRequestCheckInterval.title: Fetch request check interval(ms)
fetchRequestCheckInterval.description: The amount of time to wait before check if a request is done

fetchResponseScheduledTimeout.title: Fetch response scheduled timeout(ms)
fetchResponseScheduledTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time for a response to be scheduled. The task will be canceled if this setting is exceeded.

modified.title: Date Modified
modified.description: The date at which this Configuration was last modified.

id.title: Configuration ID
id.description: A unique identifier for this Configuration.

slackAppToken.title: Slack App access token
slackAppToken.description: The Slack application access token, this token is provided after installing the application in the workspace

profilesConfig.title: Profiles settings
profilesConfig.description: Settings to control the indexation of Slack profiles

indexGuestProfiles.title: Index guest profiles
indexGuestProfiles.description: If indexing profiles, include profiles of guest users

indexInactiveProfiles.title: Index inactive profiles
indexInactiveProfiles.description: If indexing profiles, include profiles of inactive users

channelsConfig.title: Channels and messages settings
channelsConfig.description: Settings to control the indexation of Slack channels and messages

indexChannels.title: Index channels
indexChannels.description: Generate a document in the index for each channel

indexFromArchivedChannels.title: Index archived channels
indexFromArchivedChannels.description: If indexing messages or channel data, include data from archived channels

indexFromPublicChannels.title: Index from public channels
indexFromPublicChannels.description: If indexing messages or channel data, include data from public channels

indexPrivateChannels.title: Index from private channels
indexPrivateChannels.description: If indexing messages or channel data, include data from private channels

indexDirectMessages.title: Index from direct messages
indexDirectMessages.description: If indexing messages, include private messages

indexBotMessages.title: Index bot messages
indexBotMessages.description: If indexing messages, include messages that came from bots

indexThreadReplies.title: Index thread replies
indexThreadReplies.description: If indexing messages, include messages that are replies to threads. Note: Each thread found will result in it's own API call, and is subject to rate limiting. Using this can significantly slow down indexing.

channelFilter.title: Channels to include
channelFilter.description: If indexing messages or channel data, include data only from channels with names matching the specified regular expressions

pageSize.title: Page size
pageSize.description: The number of objects requested per page from Slack

itemRetryProperties.title: Item retry settings
itemRetryProperties.description: Options to configure the retry operation for items.

maxRetries.title: Max retry attempts
maxRetries.description: The maximum number of attempts for a failed item

retryDelayInSeconds.title: Retry delay
retryDelayInSeconds.description: The amount of time, in seconds, before process again a failed item

connectionsProperties.title: Connections Settings
connectionsProperties.description: A set of options for configuring the HTTP client.

maxPerRoute.title: Max per route
maxPerRoute.description: Defines a connection limit per one HTTP route. In simple cases you can understand this as a per target host limit. Under the hood things are a bit more interesting: HttpClient maintains a couple of HttpRoute objects, which represent a chain of hosts each, like proxy1 -> proxy2 -> targetHost. Connections are pooled on per-route basis. In simple cases, when you're using default route-building mechanism and provide no proxy suport, your routes are likely to include target host only, so per-route connection pool limit effectively becomes per-host limit.

ignoreSSLValidationExceptions.title: Ignore SSL Validation Exceptions
ignoreSSLValidationExceptions.description: Do not attempt to do an SSL Handshake and do not verify the hostname of SSL certificates. Use this when accessing an https url with a self-signed or enterprise certificate authority that you do not want to put in the Java keystore.

timeouts.title: Timeout Settings
timeouts.description: A set of options for configuring the HTTP client.

collectionId.title: ACL collection id
collectionId.description: Id of the collection to be used for storing ACL records. If not specified, ACL collection name will be generated automatically using pattern '<datasource_id>_access_control_hierarchy'.
